translated: Brindeland, Anders Johan, high school teacher, born April 29, 1889, in Spannarp, Halland County, son of Carl Andersson and Sofia Pettersson. Married Lilly Lapidus in 1919. They had three children: Gunnel born in 1920, Inga-Lisa born in 1923, and Hans born in 1927. He graduated from Karlstad with a teaching degree in 1910, received a Bachelor's degree in 1918, and a Master's degree in 1919 from Uppsala University. He worked as a substitute teacher in Säffle in 1915, a teaching assistant in Växjö in 1918, a subject teacher in Haparanda in 1919, and a temporary subject teacher in Sollefteå from 1919 to 1922. He became a regular subject teacher in 1922 and a high school teacher in Sollefteå from 1930 to 1934, then in Huskvarna in 1934. He was a biology and chemistry teacher in Åmål from 1940. He was employed at Kristineberg's zoology marine research station during the summer of 1926 and was a deputy member of the Central Association for Temperance Education's third temperance committee in 1929. He was a librarian in Sollefteå from 1930 to 1934 and a principal during the holidays there from 1931 to 1933, then in Huskvarna from 1935 to 1938 and in Åmål from 1940 to 1945. He was a secretary of the Board of Education in Sollefteå from 1930 to 1934, in Huskvarna from 1935 to 1938, and in Åmål from 1940, and acting principal in the autumn of 1945. He was the chairman of the Ski Promotion Local Branch in Åmål from 1940, chairman of the Pension Committee from 1945, and secretary of the Åmåls Scouthem Foundation in 1945 as well as a member of the Board of Directors for the Dals-Långed Outdoor Garden from 1944. He was a member of the Sollefteå Lecture Association and the Åmål Lecture Association since 1944. He was the Director of the EM in skiing in Sollefteå in 1934, the Ski Promotion SM in 1934 and 1946, and received a study trip to Norway in 1928. He was a member of the Rotary Club.
